Introduction ¶

The code below is all you need to get started with single CouchDB design document.

var couchdb = require("couchdb-api");

/** default values: "localhost", 5984 **/
var server = couchdb.srv(host, port);

var db = server.db("my-database");

var ddoc = db.ddoc("my-design-document");

var view = ddoc.view("my-view");

Query ¶

GET /db/_design/ddoc/_view/view official documentation

Queries an arbitrary view, allows for querystring parameters via the first argument.

Protip: If you want to specifically get the results of either the map or reduce function for a view, use the map and reduce methods.

// specify querystring parameters (optional)
var query = { include_docs: true };
view.query(query, function (err, response) {
	// your code here...
});
Back to Top

Map ¶

GET /db/_design/ddoc/_view/view official documentation

Queries the map function of the view, allows for querystring parameters via the first argument.

This essentially acts as shorthand for query and appends reduce=false to the URL.

view.map(function (err, response) {
	// your code here...
});
Back to Top

Reduce ¶

GET /db/_design/ddoc/_view/view official documentation

Queries the reduce function of the view, allows for querystring parameters via the first argument.

This essentially acts as shorthand for query and appends reduce=true to the URL.

view.reduce(function (err, response) {
	// your code here...
});
